prompt: <description>**Instructions to generate the parametric CAD model:** **Part 1 - Bottom Prism** Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with rounded corners. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following specifications: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.375, 0.75, 0.0] With this coordinate system, draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane. The sketch should have the following properties: - Face 1 - Loop 1 - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.375, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.375, 0.0], End Point [0.375, 0.375] - Line 3: Start Point [0.375, 0.375], End Point [0.0, 0.375] - Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.375], End Point [0.0, 0.0] After creating the 2D sketch, scale it by 0.375 and extrude into 3D space with a depth of 0.375 units in the positive direction of the Z axis, using the "NewBodyFeatureOperation" operation. **Part 2 - Top Prism** Construct another three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following specifications: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.75, 0.0] With this coordinate system, draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane. The sketch should have the following properties: - Face 1 - Loop 1 - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.375, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.375, 0.0], End Point [0.375, 0.75] - Line 3: Start Point [0.375, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.75] - Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.0] After creating the 2D sketch, scale it by 0.75 and extrude into 3D space with a depth of 0.75 units in the positive direction of the Z axis. Use the "JoinFeatureOperation" operation to join the newly created 3D solid with the previous part. Please note that these instructions are provided without any additional assumptions, based only on the CAD Assembly JSON. All measurements are provided in the JSON file and the image should follow those guidelines.</description>

</json>

Step 4: Extrude the Sketch to Generate the 3D Model Extrude the sketch along its normal direction with the following properties: * Extrusion Depth Towards Normal: 0.5 * Extrusion Depth Opposite Normal: 0.0 * Sketch Scale: 0.75 The resulting 3D model should resemble a rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top and bottom. The top and bottom faces are parallel to each other, while the front and back faces are perpendicular to the top and bottom faces. The sides of the prism are straight and meet at right angles. The dimensions of the prism are approximately 3:2:1. Part 1 Metrics * Length: 0.75 * Width: 0.5 * Height: 0.75</description>
